definition: unrelenting/without stopping to rest
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
hoof/pig's trotters

sentences.english: The stakes are higher, people are restless, poised for even greater transformation.
sentences.chinese: 人們正馬不停蹄地準備迎接更大的變革。

sentences.english: The troops rushed to their destination without a single halt.
sentences.chinese: 部隊馬不停蹄地趕到了目的地。

sentences.english: Researchers believe that some hummingbirds fly non-stop over the Gulf of Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 研究員相信，一些蜂鳥會馬不停蹄地飛越墨西哥灣。

sentences.english: He was traveling around the world for months on end.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月來他馬不停蹄地周遊世界。

sentences.english: Senators Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton are campaigning in the state almost non-stop.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬和克林頓參議員正馬不停蹄地在這個州競選。

sentences.english: Grant wasted no time. He quickly sent troops to fight the Confederate force blocking the Tennessee River.
sentences.chinese: 格蘭特馬不停蹄，迅速出兵，阻南軍于田納西州河畔。

sentences.english: And July is doing its best to outdo June.
sentences.chinese: 而且七月正在馬不停蹄地超越六月。

sentences.english: You could whip around the world in a weekend if you flew non-stop.
sentences.chinese: 如果你馬不停蹄的話，一週可以游完世界。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, President Bush was going out in full stride.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，老布什總統正在馬不停蹄地出訪。

sentences.english: Then, I tirelessly went to a company the poem parents' home.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我馬不停蹄就去了商詩父母的家裏。

definition: without hesitation/resolutely/firmly
to set out on a journey
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to journey to India on a quest for the Buddhist scriptures/to learn by studying another's experience
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
in succession/one after another/continuously
to escort/to accompany
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
to rehearse/rehearsal
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
prepared against war/to prepare for war/warmongering
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
